msContents.summary: The content is both magical and medical. Loss of context makes connected translation impossible.

msItemStruct.note: Pub. status: Recto; Verso is blank

condition.ab: Two sheets of a good papyrus with writing on one side only. The first two lines seem to be complete, but the remaining sixteen have lost from a fourth to a third of their length by the breaking off of the papyrus on the right-hand side of the page. Another break, further to the left, was mended in ancient times, and the text was patched up after a fashion.

handDesc.p: The sub-Achmimic influence on the shape of certain letters, the date may be rather early. The hand is similar to rude hands often found in magical texts, but much more neat. The pen was stiff, and rather fine for the size of letters.

origin.origPlace: unknown, possibly written south of Asyut, Upper Egypt

provenance.p: unknown, possibly written south of Asyut, Upper Egypt
